intro: Manettia calycosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, which are followed by small, round berries. Manettia calycosa is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in lowland forests and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
